content.text:
# Bug Fixes

Several bug fixes were implemented in recent pull requests:

- Fixed missing comma between regex expressions (PR #3987)
- Fixed a typo (PR #3984)
- Fixed an error in plugin-tee (PR #3982)
- Made client use relative URL and added Firefox fixes (PR #3979)
- Fixed storage of postgres connection URL in global config (PR #3977)
- Fixed terminology by replacing "CONFIGURACIONES" with "CONFIGURACIÓN" (PR #3970)
- Fixed incorrect timeout comment (PR #3968)
- Removed TEE logs output (PR #3966)
- Fixed chat UI alignment (PR #4001)
- Reduced payload size to prevent database update failure (PR #4000)
- Fixed parsing of loglevel and enhanced logger functionality with custom prettifiers format (PR #3995)
- Improved clean command (PR #3990)

# New Features

Several new features were added to the project:

- Added Drizzle table to public schema (PR #3999)
- Improved group panel functionality (PR #3996)
- Added TEE CI/CD pipeline (PR #3994)
- Added GUI client room feature (PR #3983)

# Testing Improvements

The testing framework was enhanced with:

- Added plugin bootstrap tests (PR #3959)
- Validated and tested CLI commands functionality (PR #4004)

# Documentation and UI Improvements

Various documentation and UI enhancements were made:

- Updated README.md (PR #3985)
- Enhanced start CLI command (PR #4002)
- Made UI improvements (PR #3997)
- Moved knowledge to its own tab (PR #3992)
- Improved V2 develop docs frontpage and llms.txt (PR #3991)

categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in the Eliza Project

content.text:
## UI and User Experience Improvements

Several pull requests focused on enhancing the user interface and experience:

- Fixed an issue with the AI writer rerendering (#3969)
- Improved real-time display of thoughts messages (#3967)
- Refactored bubble layout to fix an issue where elements stick together for short messages (#3965)
- Fixed a button label issue (#3964)
- Added documentation versioning to switch between v0.25.9 and v1.0.0-alpha docs (#3963)
- Implemented a GUI client room feature (#3983)
- Made client use relative URL instead of hardcoded localhost and fixed Firefox compatibility issues related to crypto.randomUUID (#3979)

## Backend and Infrastructure Improvements

- Added clear logs method and API (#3974)
- Simplified connection status (#3973)
- Fixed log display and APIs (#3971)
- Added comprehensive test coverage for plugin storage S3, including tests for file uploads, signed URL generation, and JSON data uploads (#3976)
- Removed TEE logs out and moved logs to be implemented through plugins (#3966)
- Fixed how Postgres connection URLs are handled during project creation with proper validation and storage (#3977)
- Fixed an error in plugin-tee by removing TEEVendors that no longer exists in core (#3982)

## Documentation and Minor Fixes

- Fixed Spanish terminology in documentation, replacing "CONFIGURACIONES" with "CONFIGURACIÓN" for better clarity (#3970)
- Corrected an incorrect timeout comment, noting that 1200 tenths of a second is 120 seconds, not 60 (#3968)
- Fixed a broken link in README.md (#3985)
- Fixed a missing comma between regex expressions that caused a syntax error (#3987)
- Fixed a typo in parameter name from "initalData" to "initialData" (#3984)

# ElizaOS Development and Community Updates

## Technical Developments

### ElizaOS v2 Beta
- The beta release was delayed but is now live with some stability issues
- Major improvements include a new GUI, Tauri app, CLI, and in-browser editor
- Simplified API with runtime-based operations that no longer requires character files
- WebSocket API was added to a development branch, enabling direct API access for chat terminals
- The team is actively fixing bugs to ensure Spartan functions properly in v2

### RAG Knowledge Implementation
- Users struggled with configuring knowledge directories
- Solution: Place knowledge files in `characters/knowledge/<your_directory>` and ensure `.md` format
- Common issues include missing `enableRag: true` in character.json and incorrect file paths
- Fix: Use `mkdir -p ./characters/knowledge/biotic/` to create missing directories

### Plugin Issues
- Multiple users faced issues with `plugin-sql` in v2
- `@elizaos/plugin-sql@^0.25.6` dependency not found for some users
- Suggested fix: Use `npm install -g @elizaos/cli@1.0.0-beta.1`
- OAuth2 authentication for plugins requires a custom API for handling access/refresh tokens

## Community Discussions

### Tokenomics & Utility
- Questions raised about the utility of the AI16Z token
- HackMD document with tokenomics details exists but is still a work in progress
- Some community members defend the "product first, then whitepaper" strategy

### Marketing & Communication
- Gaps highlighted in ElizaOS's marketing strategy, including lack of continuous updates
- Poor partner engagement and weak Twitter presence noted
- Plans to improve documentation and news aggregation
- ElizaOS launchpad announcement had low visibility (only in Discord, not Twitter/Telegram)

### DAO & Community Engagement
- Proposal to create a "DAO Organization" working group to improve community engagement
- Plans to open a channel specifically for partners

## Cryptocurrency Trading Discussions

- Users track price movements of various tokens on Solana
- Discussion of investment strategies, entry and exit points
- Analysis of project viability based on developer activity and token gating
- Reflection on the intersection of AI and crypto projects

categories.title: elizaOS Updates and AI Assistant Plans

content.text: elizaOS 1.0.0-alpha has been released, with new documentation published at elizaos.com. The team acknowledges it's still in beta stage with ongoing improvements needed.

Plans are underway to develop an AI assistant trained on the same data as elizaOS to help users on Discord, Telegram, and the website. The prototype called @thejintern is being upgraded to v2, with intentions to eventually open source a version that anyone can run.
The team also appreciates UI feedback, such as the dropdown button for quickly grabbing text that was mentioned in response to Stripe's developer account.

categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in the elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Several pull requests have been made to the elizaOS/eliza repository, focusing on GUI improvements, testing, and documentation enhancements:

- PR #3983 by tcm390 adds a GUI client room feature
- PR #3959 by ai16z-demirix implements plugin bootstrap tests
- PR #3979 by odilitime fixes client URL handling to use relative URLs and addresses Firefox-specific issues
- PR #3988 by lalalune appears to be a contribution announcement
- PR #3991 by madjin improves the v2 development documentation frontpage and updates the llms.txt file
- PR #4003 by natefikru sets up RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) functionality
- PR #3992 by wtfsayo moves knowledge content to its own tab in the interface

The crypto market shows fluctuations in prices for two tracked cryptocurrencies. WBTC (Wrapped Bitcoin) is currently trading between $82,596.38 and $83,847.71, showing some volatility. Meanwhile, ai16z is trading at a much lower price point, between $0.17 and $0.20, also displaying price movement.

categories.title: Recent GitHub Issues in the Eliza Repository

content.text:
Several issues have been reported in the Eliza repository:

1. Raw newline characters (\n) appearing in tweets, tweet replies, and quotes. Examples of this issue can be seen in specific tweets shared by user CadmosThalia.

2. A request for examples of plugins as defined in the codebase. The code checks if a package.json contains an 'eliza' section with type='plugin' or type='project' to determine if the current directory contains an Eliza plugin or project.

3. A guide for remote debugging in v2, which involves using Bun with the --inspect-brk flag to specify an IP address and port, along with a JSON configuration for attaching the debugger.

Recent development efforts have focused on both new features and bug fixes. The team added a clear logs method and API, while also addressing a total of 8 bug fixes, including an error in the plugin-tee. Across these efforts, 15 contributors participated, merging 13 PRs. All of this work contributed to various improvements to the codebase.
sources: text: Development focused on new features (add clear logs method and api), 5 bug fixes. with 9 contributors merging 8 PRs. Major work included various improvements.
text: Development focused on package improvements (error in plugin-tee), 3 bug fixes. with 6 contributors merging 5 PRs. Major work included various improvements.

content.text: The elizaos/eliza repository showed increased activity over a two-day period. From March 18-19, 2025, there were 6 new PRs with 10 merged, along with 2 new issues and 14 active contributors. Activity increased the following day (March 19-20, 2025) with 16 new PRs, 13 of which were merged, 2 new issues, and the same number of active contributors (14).

The provided sources mention 'Top contributors for elizaOS/eliza' but do not provide any specific details about who these contributors are or their contributions to the project. Without additional information, it's not possible to generate a detailed summary about the individual contributors, their roles, or the nature of their contributions to the elizaOS/eliza project.
